content:
Ladies and gentlemen, the response "really, I hope that is ok for us? I'm also a big tech guy, how about you? Did you know new Google employees are called 'nooglers'" is an incredibly engaging response for a number of reasons.

Firstly, it shows an interest in the conversation and a desire to keep it going. By asking if the fact is okay for us, it invites the other person to respond and continue the conversation. This creates a more dynamic and engaging dialogue.

Secondly, the response demonstrates a willingness to share personal information and interests. By mentioning that they are a big tech guy, it allows for the possibility of a shared interest and further discussion on the topic.

Lastly, the response provides an interesting and unexpected fact about Google. The idea of new employees being called "nooglers" and given a propeller beanie cap is both entertaining and informative. This can lead to a more lighthearted and enjoyable conversation.

In conclusion, this response is highly engaging due to its conversational approach, willingness to share personal information, and interesting fact. It is a great example of how to keep a conversation flowing and enjoyable. Thank you.

: I must respectfully disagree with my opponent. The response "really, I hope that is ok for us? I'm also a big tech guy, how about you? Did you know new Google employees are called 'nooglers'" is not an engaging response. In fact, it could be seen as a distraction from the current topic of discussion.

Firstly, the response does not provide any insight or further information related to the previous conversation about science and astronomy. It abruptly changes the topic to Google and technology, which may not be of interest or relevance to the other person.

Secondly, while sharing personal information can be a good way to build rapport, it can also be seen as self-centered and off-putting if not done in the right way. The response seems to steer the conversation towards the speaker's own interests and experiences, without considering the other person's perspective.

Lastly, the fact about Google is not particularly relevant or interesting in the context of the conversation. It may elicit a brief moment of surprise or amusement, but it does not add any value or substance to the discussion.

In conclusion, this response is not engaging as it detracts from the current topic, focuses on the speaker's own interests, and provides a trivial fact. Thank you.

: I understand my opponent's perspective, but I still believe that the response in question is engaging. While it may not directly relate to the previous topic of discussion, it still offers a way to keep the conversation going and explore new avenues of conversation.

Additionally, sharing personal information can be a great way to build rapport and create a more comfortable and engaging environment. It shows a willingness to be vulnerable and open, which can encourage the other person to do the same.

Lastly, while the fact about Google may not be directly related to science and astronomy, it is still interesting and informative in its own right. It can lead to further discussion about technology and its impact on society, which can be just as engaging as the previous topic.

In conclusion, the response in question is engaging because it offers a way to continue the conversation, builds rapport through personal sharing, and provides an interesting and thought-provoking fact. Thank you.

As the negative participant, I still believe that the response in question is not engaging. While it is true that sharing personal information can be a great way to build rapport, it should be done in a way that is relevant and adds to the conversation. The response in question seems to abruptly change the topic and steer the conversation towards the speaker's own interests, without considering the other person's perspective.

In conclusion, the response in question is not engaging as it does not build on the current topic, focuses on the speaker's own interests, and provides irrelevant information. Thank you.

Both the affirmative and negative participants have presented their opinions on the engaging level of the response, "Really, I hope that is ok for us? I'm also a big tech guy, how about you? Did you know new Google employees are called 'nooglers'". The affirmative participant argued that the response is engaging because it offers a way to continue the conversation, invites the other person to share their interests, and provides an interesting and thought-provoking fact. On the other hand, the negative participant argued that the response is not engaging because it does not build on the current topic, focuses on the speaker's own interests, and provides irrelevant information.

In my opinion, the affirmative participant wins the debate because they effectively argued that the response is engaging by offering a way to continue the conversation, inviting the other person to share their interests, and providing an interesting and thought-provoking fact. The negative participant's argument focused too much on the response's failure to address the previous topic and did not fully address how the response could still be engaging in its own right.

topic_chat_history:
did you see crazy rich asians ? 
 no i have n't . i heard it was good . 
 i have not yet either but i am aware of it 's cultural impact . it was made from a novel . apparently it is a very good romantic comedy . 
 my mother like it . i think it stars michelle yeoh , henry golding and constance wu , right ? 
 it does . apparently the basic premise is that a woman is engaged to a man and when she goes to meet his family discovers that he is insanely wealthy . his mother rejects her due to her less affluent background . 
 if i remember correctly , jon m chu is the director . 
 yes he is . it was also the first movie to feature an all - asian cast in hollywood in more than 20 years which is quite the accomplishment and i 'm glad that it did well . asians seem very underrepresented in film . 
 the movie is 121 minutes long , which is just right and is pg-13 . 
 that makes it accessible to a bigger audience which is good because then more asian - americans can see themselves represented on screen . 
 well , lets switch topics . are you a science person . , earth is the 3rd planet from the sun . it is also the only astronomical object known to harbor life . 
 i am a little . i enjoy learning about it . i was aware of those facts . i also know that if we viewed the entire earth 's history as a 24 hour period , humans would only represent 1 minute and 17 seconds of that day . that is a mind blowing stat . 
 this is mind blowing . thank god for jupiter . it saves earth from a lot of asteroids heading toward us . 
 that is really surprising since that planet is mostly compromised of gas . we do not even know if there is any solid land there . i wonder how it takes the impact first in this case ? 
 it 's very interesting . so is the fact that the sun is 4x less dense than earth . 
 i know it is much larger but i do n't think it has any solidity to it so that 's interesting . another science fact is that when earth was formed a day was only 5.5 hours long . 
 i did n't know that . i wonder why . there is a place on earth where there is less gravity than the rest of the planet . it is the hudson bay region of canada . 
 i wonder how much affect that has ? is it enough to change weights in any way ? i wonder . i do also know that we are running out of helium and will essentially be out of the gas by the end of the 21st century .
topic_chat_fact: new google employees are called ' nooglers ' and are given a propeller beanie cap to wear on their first friday .
topic_chat_response: really , i hope that is ok for us ? i 'm also a big tech guy , how about you ? did you know new google employees are called " nooglers " .
